Reviews.Title: “HOTEL DE LA BRETONNERIE EXCELLENTE IN THE HEART OF MARAIS DISTRICT -PARIS”
Reviews.Author: filipponina
Reviews.Content: I have been twice at this hotel and it is excellent. An ancient charming building with clean, confortable and pleasant rooms. The hotel is small but very cosy, warm and polite/friendly atmosphere. If you stay at this wonderful hotel you are going to be in the heart of Marais district, 10 minutes walking distance from Baubourg / Centre Pompidou or magnificent Plavce Des Voges. I reccomend this hotel for everybody that would like to stay at the Marais in a 'parisienne' atmosphere. Book a Chambre de Charmetyoe when possible.

Reviews.Title: “Classic French charm in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Stilzski
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the location is great, in the bustling Marais district. The first impression as one enters is of old-world, almost rural French charm. We booked a junior suite (35) and were surprised how spacious and quiet it was for central Paris. The bedroom with superking - or two twins - with two attractive canopies was a decent size, with antique/reproduction furniture. The lighting could have been better for reading in bed, and we are more used to a duvet than a blanket, but the beds were comfortable. Between the bedroom and the bathroom was a separate room with a TV and sleigh bed that doubled up as a sofa. The roomy, airy travertine-tiled bathroom - with two windows overlooking and internal courtyard as did our bedroom - had a bath (with shower attachment), two inset basins and a separate WC. The towels could have been larger and fluffier. Everything was clean, with typically-French, fabric-covered walls - either in a deep red or beige and white floral, the latter the same as used on the bed canopies. The whole effect was classic but classy. Everyone at reception was very friendly and helpful and although our room was not cheap, we felt it was worth the outlay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely piece of Paris”
Reviews.Author: kathleenp437
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Paris for a few days every year when travel to Europe. We love the quaintness and size of this hotel. We stay there every time. Clean, vintage and near Notre Dame and Ile St..Louis. Simple, and the staff is so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Raj R
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers - the location can't be beat, and while the hotel is not super modern, they had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable, and the wifi worked very well. We had a "charming" room which was, in fact, charming, with little dormer windows in the room and in the bathroom, looking out over the street. Front desk staff were helpful, and check in/check out were a breeze. Continental breakfast was in a charming dining room downstairs, and was a great way to start the day. Because of Paris traffic, getting to the hotel in a taxi from Gare du Nord was a nightmare; on our way back we just took the Metro and it was really easy and quick. Two things we didn't like: Our room was apparently a converted attic, so the ceiling was really low, so we had to hunch over to avoid hitting our heads. In the bathroom, it would have been nice if there were a shower door or curtain (shower was a handheld one) so that water didn't get all over the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MaximBezembinder
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely three star hotel. The room we stayed in (room 29) was relatively small with a lovely four poster bed! It was classicaly decorated and very clean. And the most important thing: the bed was excellent. Bathroom had everything you needed, again, it was not very big! The receptionist were very friendly and helpfull. And the location is ideal: just a short walk to the Notre-Dame de Paris, de Centre George Pompidou and soo many eateries around that you could stay for a year and never eat in the same restaurant twice! We didn't have breakfast in the hotel (was not included in the price anyway), but went around the corner to a place called "Pan", which was ideal! Oh, and the metro stop is a hop and a skip away! Will we go back? Yes!!! Will I recomend this place? Yes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, and customer-friendly”
Reviews.Author: FromMurphyTo
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel during our Christmas holiday in Paris. I highly recommend it in several areas. First, from the beginning, the staff at this hotel were very polite and helpful. The members of my group were arriving at different times on different days, and this was not a problem. One of the receptionists even emailed me to let me know that my brother had arrived safely. Next, the hotel is not "sparkling new" in its decor, but more importantly it is very clean and comfortable. My family and I occupied a junior suite for the duration of our stay, and we found it to be plenty big enough to accommodate us well. It was also very quiet. Last, it would be difficult to find a hotel better located in relation to the Metro, the Marais, and the heart of Paris. It's maybe a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame, less to Hotel de Ville and the Metro, there are plenty of bakeries, markets, and restaurants nearby, and shopping on Rue de Rivoli is just steps away. I would definitely return to Hotel de la Bretonnerie. It would be difficult to find a hotel with better value for the money, location, and welcoming staff than this traditional French hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value In A Charming Hotel In The Heart Of Marais”
Reviews.Author: gerardlee
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 4 nights at Hotel de la Bretonnerie in early Oct11. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any of my fellow travellers. Excellent location with Hotel de Ville metro barely 5mins away. The hotel is surrounded by heaps of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, boulangeries etc...We even walked to Musee de Orsay & back. Notre Dame is 15mins away. Great breakfasts at Le Pain Quotidien. It also has a supermarket 2mins away. We stocked up on water, wine, cheese & fruit. The room I stayed in was a Classic Room and was wonderful. On the top floor with a large bed and a mini refrigerator. The bathroom was recently renovated and large enough. No problems with hot water etc...We were there in Autumn so it was quite cool. The rooms do not have air conditioning, however they do have fans. So in summer this needs to be considered. The staff were most obliging and nothing was a problem. As the hotel is located in a real party area the street below did get a bit noisy. For 159Euros per night, I could not recommend this highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: leary81
Reviews.Content: We were on a family vacation with four grown adults. Because we all like each other so much, we searched for QUADS/FAMILY ROOMS. Bretonnerie had a family room . On the website, however, it wouldn't allow us to click the four-person room. After searching other locations (and coming up empty), we came back to Bretonnerie because they had another room that also accommodated four people (it was a 3 person room + rollaway). We booked it. It was the top floor room and it perfectly would have suited three grown adults. With four people, we certainly made it work. The rollaway fit in fine - but please note - if you're tall people (like we are), you may want to hold out for the four-person room - as this room had SLANTED ceilings and LOW BEAMS. The room was beautiful, many windows, etc.... The bathroom was HUGE, totally acceptable for four tall Americans :). It had two sinks, and a tub... NO SHOWER HEAD (but a detached hand-held sprayer like shower head....) The front desk staff spoke primarily French. They were friendly and helpful - but also very French - so don't be alarmed when they're not impressed that you don't speak their language... The area was lovely, many wonderful French cafes (and a Starbucks - where they DO speak English :)). There was a laundromat across the street - which was SUPER nice as we were at the tail-end of our trip (and clean clothes)... We walked everywhere along the river. Great location. Would I / we stay there again... yes!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jhugon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our first stay in this small hotel in the Marais area of Paris (4th "arrondissement"), just steps away from the Centre Pompidou, the Quais of the Seine, and a short walk from the Place des Vosges. For less than 150 Euros per night, our room on the third floor was small but cozy and comfortable, with a large and modern bathroom (featuring a large tub but no separate shower). Our room featured a good mixture of character and modern amenities, with lovely exposed beams in the ceiling showing the age of the building, while the throughly modern windows blocked out all street noises. We would have wished for a bit softer towels, and there was a bit of mold in the corner of our tub, but the convenience, charm and value of this hotel made it easy to overlook these details. We will be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: Berwin2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location.The Marais is a wonderful area to stay in. You can walk to most things. Notre Dame, San Chappelle, Latin Quarter, Louve and even the Marais is a wonderful area to walk around, great achitecture. There are loads of restaurants and shops in the area. The Metro is about 4 blocks away at the Hotel deVille. It is a very active area at night. especially weekends because of the huge Gay presence. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They are genuinely concerned about their guests. They will help you plan your Metro routes and provide touring suggestions. That is not to say that this hotel does not have its warts. First, it is not air conditioned. Secondly, not every room has a shower. Some have a bahtub with a handheld shower. This was our case, and it does present a challenge. But isn't travel about experiences. However, the room was large by Paris standards and was able to accomodate our suitcases. The furniture is somewhat rustic. Do not expect a flat screen TV. They offer a breakfast in the basement of the hotel (very unique cavelike decor) which covers most of your basics for 9 1/2 euro. They even have a machine that squeezes oranges. Kids love it. Various breads, pastries, yogurts, some cheese, meats, cereals, coffee and tea. To conclude, when I return to Paris this hotel will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: KincsZoltan
Reviews.Content: We finally got a room after planning our trip in advance - short-term travelers will be lucky to get a room. And there is a good reason for this. This historical inn oozes charm in one of the most lively neighborhoods in Paris - Marais - a mix of hipster, gay, Orthodox Jewish and trendy. Walk out the door and you have so many restaurants, cafes, shops, museums and beautiful architecture to tempt you. Reception was very friendly, there was a computer in the lobby for free internet, and the room was spacious and clean with old world features like wooden beams and creaky floors. We loved it. My partner told me not to review this place - it will only get more difficult to get a room... Oh well, too late.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing period hotel in a very Fab area”
Reviews.Author: jeff.francis
Reviews.Content: This really is an amazing place! This is a lovely old heritage hotel with each rooms different. The rooms are decorated in period design,which is lovely. The one small problem is the rooms are not air-conditioned, however, unless it is really hot, this shouldn't be a problem. Also the front desk is open 24/7 and the staff are really helpful and friendly. The area is very vibrant and central to all of Paris, with 2 metros and walking distance to most of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and super friendly helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: teaboston
Reviews.Content: Our family with 2 12 year olds stayed at the Hotel de la Bretonnerie for 3 night following a canal barge tour in the south. The women at the front desk the entire stay were the nicest hotel staff we have experienced. It is an older hotel and felt very cozy and comfortable. Finding large rooms for families is not that easy in Paris but our room was both large, neat and clean. Location was very convenient to so many attractions. We had stayed at a much higher rated hotel before our trip to the south and all of us voted that this hotel was better experience than a top 10 tripadvisor hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very quient, and quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Carmen3041
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quient. A little old style, and in a quiet little area. Which is considered the San Francisco of Paris. We walked to all the nearby cafes, and restaurants nearby. Also, lots of stores nearby, including a Mall. It's centrally located only a few blocks from Palace de Hotel de Ville Metro Station. Also, a 15 minute walk to the Louve, and Notre Dame de Paris. The Hotel de la Bretonnerie had a nice size bathroom, our room was moderate size. No air conditioning. Although, it was cool during the time we were there. They provide free WiFi, and a nice complementary breakfast in the morning. We didn't spend much time in the room. So for the price we thought it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: wreid10968
Reviews.Content: Pros We stayed in room 21. Larger than expected with a very nice bathroom. Area was much quieter than expected. The breakfast is good but not great. The orange juice machine is terrific. They provided two fans for us so A/C was not a problem. Less than 50 meters to laundry. Interesting local shops. Good but not great restaurants. Location is great close to metro and a terrific 'street scene'. Cons TV channels are limited. Only one PC with a very slow internet connection. Other The neighborhood is decidely gay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quirky & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fell0w_Traveller49
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times now - they must be doing something right! A typical Marais 3 star - very small rooms, individualistic, tiny slow lifts, good breakfast in the cave (watch your head!) most staff helpful esp the Canadienne. great location at the Les Halles end of the Marais in the middle of gay Paree. We'll be back, if I can convince people on the Metro to stop stealing my wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Fatheroftwokids
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for us. The rooms were charming, wonderful, clean and quiet. The neighborhood had just the right amount of activity for us, vibrant without being loud. In particular, the staff was very welcoming. The front desk lady spoke perfect English and was extremely helpful. The breakfast was very good, with the usual bread, croissants, cereal, yogurt, coffee, and freshly squeezed orange juice. The building is a bit old and it shows. However, the staff and location more than makes up for it. There is no air-conditioning. We had two fans in the two rooms and it was very comfortable. We stayed in six hotels during this Europe trip and we enjoyed this hotel the best. We will definitely return when we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “I've found my home away from home in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: LunaSombra
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about Hotel Bretonnerie: the charming room, the great location, the vibrant neighborhood, the quiet inside (especially as the street was so lively), how spotlessly clean everything was, and especially how kind and welcoming the staff were. This is a great value, and an absolutely delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: DebbietheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bretonnerie with a couple of girlfriends in April and had a fabulous time. The room was comfortable, the location was excellent, and the people at the desk were friendly and helpful. I wanted to share this wonderful hotel with my husband on our trip in June and made a booking. Upon arrival, we learned that they had made a mistake with the booking and did not have a room for us. They made a booking for us in a similar hotel, covered the extra cost, and also paid for our breakfast. They also let us use their computer to print boarding passes and made dinner reservations for us. This was above and beyond what they needed to do, and shows what type of classy establishment they are. I will definitely return and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Way exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: julesd68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a family room with three beds. The room was spotless and very tastefully decorated in a traditional style with very high quality materials. Staff were always helpful, polite and eager to help. I could hear some music in our room from the shop next door which although not late, was bothering me - the guy on reception actually went next door and told them to turn it down! This sums up their super helpful attitude to me. The location is right in the heart of the Marais and a perfect base to sightsee from. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and staff in a great location - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JTworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We travel a fair bit and knew that in the $300 range in early March we weren't going to get into the top hotel in Paris. So we adjusted expectations -- but were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were pleasant and clean with decent elbow room. But I had to go out into the stairwell to pick up the wifi signal. Breakfast was a decent continental served in a wine-cave like basement. But the fresh orange juice squeezer kept jamming. Everyone on the front desk was helpful and couldn't do enough for us! If you ignore the quirks....it's a great value. We will absolutely stay there next time we are in Paris (unless the client is paying!!)

Reviews.Title: “Intimate elegance in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: Navajorug
Reviews.Content: I spent the last 2 nights of a 2-week stay in France at Hotel de la Bretonnerie, and it was a wonderful end to a great vacation. This small hotel in the Marais district of Paris was elegant, comfortable and welcoming. I had a "charming" room, which costs a bit extra, and it was just great. Comfortable bed, windows looking out on the busy street, a full bath with windows of its own, well-furnished and appointed. The room was perfectly quiet despite how busy the neighborhood is, and I slept very well. The staff were all very helpful and professional, tolerant of my poor French and completely fluent in English. They were helpful with arrangements for dinner and transportation as well. The Marais district is very busy, in an old part of the city with narrow streets and many small shops. There are lots of restaurants, bistros, bars and boulangeries in the area and one can eat well and often with little effort. The hotel is barely 2 blocks from Centre Pompidou, the outstanding modern art museum, and I spent longer there than at any other museum on my entire vacation. The Jewish quarter is close by, and Pace des Vosges is less than 10 minutes walk. Ile de la Cite is just across the bridge, another 10 minute walk, so Notre Dame cathedral is in easy reach as well. The Louvre is just past the Pompidou. All in all, a great location, especially if you want a hotel in a neighborhood with some night life. Hotel de la Bretonnerie was a delightful way to end a French vacation. It's not the cheapest place to stay, but it well deserves its 3-star rating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Total Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: NYCop
Reviews.Content: Been trying to stay here for years, finally got a reservation, a Junior Suite. Delightfully quirky, original and totally Marais. We loved the location, in the center of everything. All the Staff, from the Maids tothe Front Desk went that extra mile and were wonderful. The breakfast in the cellar was amazing. We loved the whole experience so much that we immediately booked for our trip to Paris next year

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Ramond
Reviews.Content: This is a Parisian boutique hotel on a quaint street right in the centre of the Marais with its endless boutiques, brasseries, galleries and museums. The location is perfect for exploring Paris - the Notre Dame and the Place des Vosges are both easily reachable by foot, and the back of the Pompidou peeps out between the little streets behind the hotel. Our room was more than large by Paris standards, withj wooden beams under the ceiling, a king-size bed, and a very spacious and well-equipped bathroom. The continental breakfast (with eggs to order) was more than adequate. The staf were friendly and informative, and the lobby has free internet service as weall as a big selection of English books. We cannot wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Monica15
Reviews.Content: It is a nice, charming hotel, the location is right in the center of Paris. We were in a charming room, which is the middle one in terms of money. It is a big room, but not a cheap one, but in Paris if you want a nice hotel you have to pay, and this one is not that expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great price great location will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Rhianna-Gibbs
Reviews.Content: I went for a couple of nights in March 2010 it's a small hotel in a great area of Paris. Rooms are a decent size and the décor is 10 / 10. I found there was a retail shop right next door which would play music though once it hit 18:00 the music stopped besides that the hotel has no other noises. Breakfast was about 10 EURO in a beautiful small joint restaurant downstairs with great croissant, yoghurt, toast, cereal ect with tea or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jmac500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Perfect location. Very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful and they were more than happy to book restaurants and taxis for us. It really made our stay in Paris very special to be in such a nice hotel. The Marais area is an ideal place to be based for sight-seeing and there are lots of nice restaurants, coffees shops & window shopping within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeelyC
Reviews.Content: It's a charming hotel, superb location in a lovely district, very helpful staff, and I would highly recommend it. Lovely warm and comfortable room. Best thing about the hotel was the location, right in the middle of the Marais district, and across the river fom the spectacular Notre Dame. Margaret, Lorcan & Ciaran Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: ptb387
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel de la Bretonnerie in Paris for a week in early October. Our room, #7, faced a tiny inner courtyard, so it was very quiet at night. The room was spacious, well appointed and spotlessly clean. The front desk staff was very helpful in all respects, including making the call to confirm our transportation to the airport at the end of our stay. The Hotel de Ville metro station is about a 7 minute walk away. This was the first time we had stayed in the Marais neighborhood, and we loved the proximity of many wonderful restaurants as well as a nearby fruit vendor, creperie and boulangerie/patisserie.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value & service”
Reviews.Author: Alicarrmiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel de la Bretonnerie for two nights last weekend and we would happily return to it in the future. Our room (29) had a good, strong shower (I am a shower person & would have been very unhappy to get a room with only a bath) and a four poster bed. There was a safe in the closet and decent shampoo and shower gel. Power points by the bed were handy for recharging iphones and ipods & when we asked for a wifi code we were given one. I found the front desk staff warm and helpful - particularly Karen who was very charming. It's not a fancy hotel and it doesn't pretend to be. It is in a fantastic location in the Marais and very easy to walk to many of the great sites of Paris but also very well located for the Hotel de Ville metro if you're going further afield. It is very clean and well cared for - sure it could use a bit of updating here and there & I'm sure that will happen over time but absolutely no complaints from us. We had a delightful stay. We will definitely use this hotel on future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mgirrl
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research on hotels in Paris and found Hotel Bretonnerie to be an excellent value. The location was also very good, in the heart of the Marais. The room was wallpapered from the ceiling to the floor which was charming. The bathroom was very clean and modern. We originally didn't think we would pay the additional money for the breakfast, but after seeing the prices in Paris, the price of breakfast at the hotel was very reasonable. The orange juice was freshed squeezed and the selection of food was similar to most europeon bed and breakfast's. We enjoyed our stay there very much. The staff was also helpful with directions. We would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, big room.”
Reviews.Author: AndyJB
Reviews.Content: Our room (37) was large, with a 4 poster standard sized double bed. The room was big (for a Parisian 3*) with plenty of room for the provided good quality cot. Service was adequate, the location excellent. The decor (on our floor) was a little tired: it will need refurbishing soon. No air conditioning so I would be worried staying here in the summer months. Didn't eat breakfast there, we just wandered round the corner to Les Philosophes on Vieille du Temple which is our favourite place for breakfast in Le Marais. Given the location and room size this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “great location; good price; uneven friendliness of staff”
Reviews.Author: mmg150
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was nice . The location here is what makes this hotel an excellent choice. For the price, the room we had was fine. We were in room 35 which was considered a junior suite for 4 people. One of the beds; however, was a cot that was added to the second bedroom. The bathroom was very large and well appointed. Plenty of space for all of us. We ate breakfast in the surrounding cafes, preferring that to the hotel breakfast. The biggest complaint I have relates to the staff. There was a very friendly dark haired woman who was always quite helpful; however, on our last evening and morning there was a very unfriendly older gentleman. He made getting a taxi to the train station a much bigger process than was necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Meddy094
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in the Marais (4th arrondissement) and close to lots of good restaurants and bars in addition to lots of the major sights. The reception area is welcoming and cozy with a good selection of international newspapers and friendly staff. We were a little disappointed with the room which was quite small and dark, although perfectly clean. It was also very hot at night even though a fan was provided (no air-conditioning). Free wi-fi was available but the connection was sometimes temperamental.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Chic, and French!”
Reviews.Author: RJBCNB
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very nice, the room (7) was large enough for us and the large bathroom was clean and well presented. The hotel is very French, it has uneven floors and is decorated to keep it dark inside. the old wooden beams give it the charm and character. The breakfast room is the old cellar, it is small but very pleasant, the breakfast fare was plentiful and good quality. Recently out stay was blessed with hot weather, not good for the cellar, it was hot and the hotel only had a small fan to move the air around. The staff were charming although maybe sometimes they seemed pre-occupied with their job. There if free internet access in the lobby too. As it was hot AC would be nice, however it has none. Personally this would spoil the charm of the hotel, the staff had put fans in our room and once placed correctly we were able to sleep in the heat of the night. I would recommend this hotel as it gave us a very nice central base to explore Paris on foot. As anther reviewer says, this area is predominately Gay (both sexes) for us this enhanced the area as we spoke to some groups in bars and restaurants and they were very pleasant company. the other bonus in the area is the small Jewish area that has some fine bars and restaurants and places to snack. All the streets are narrow and hide many place of interest, you can just wander from street to street and enjoy the atmosphere. Overall this hotel gets the thumbs up. I recommend the city bus tours to see this lovely city too.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful if you can live w/o a/c. Fun neighborhood and fun decor.”
Reviews.Author: ksachnoff
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. One room for me and my husband (a jr. suite, with the bed upstairs) and one for grama and 11 year old (charming room). No views to speak of but plenty of light and huge windows, high ceilings (except in bathroom in sutie). Weakness of charming room 'twin' beds was they were about 1/2 inch apart so they may as well have shared a bed. Great beds, storage, quiet with windows fully closed, nice staff, everything worked, lovely bathrooms, charming breakfast room and generous breakfast. Plenty of blankets and pillows of both kinds. They were very tolerant of our pre-teen and extensive luggage to be stored. Loved the Etoile cafe at end of the street, check out the cool bathrooms there! Good shopping and dining area.

Reviews.Title: “The gift of a lifetime,”
Reviews.Author: iloveparis79
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Sally Peabody, of Your Great Day in Paris , my dream of seeing Paris has come true beyond my wildest expectations. We stayed in the Le Marais, a lively district full of great cafes, boutiques, excellent small local restaurants, small museums, markets, parks, full of classic architecture. At first glance I felt we had no reason to leave our neighborhood! The Hotel was a small, perhaps 22 room, quiet oasis in these lively, happy streets. Originally a 17th century townhouse, we were pleased with a large comfortable clean room and bathroom. Wireless available in the lobby with absolutely wonderful staff 24/7. It's a 3 star due to no a/c, but all needs are met and requests granted. Highly recommend as well as services of YourGreatDayinParis.com a way to truly see the city as you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value and location”
Reviews.Author: NJGirl999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the week that volcanic ash halted all travel and wished we'd stayed there for our first week in Paris. The loft junior suite felt more like a little apartment; the hotel was spotless and charming; and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. And the Seine was a 5 minute walk. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. One caveat: there is no air conditioning and the loft in the duplex was warm. Consider a regular room in wamer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but attic room made me feel like hunchback of Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: pawdy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay at this hotel, but the attic room with sloping ceilings made me walk hunched over all the time so that I wouldn't bean myself on one of the beams. The room was quiet though but in the summer I bet it would be hot, hot, hot. The staff was very helpful and the hotel was clean with good modern plumbing and decorations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Annette15
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night - arriving in the early hours of the morning due to a train strike- . Night staff had waited up for us not knowing when we would arrive. The exceptional service and helpfulness continued the next day as we tried to contact our airline to sort out flights. In addition our room was lovely- over two levels and absolutely quiet. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and recommended on balance”
Reviews.Author: jonben
Reviews.Content: With such a large number of options and so many parts of the city to consider, this hotel ticked most of the boxes. My wife and I were traveling with our 14 and 10 year olds and we still prefer to keep them close by, so look for family of adjoining rooms where possible. The de la Bretonnerie has several family rooms and ours, for three nights, was ample in size, which is not a given in Paris. We had a minibar fridge, which can be useful for storing pastries! There is also an in room safe. The TV only had five channels, and only one was in English, but this was not an issue for us. The most serious drawback was that the toilet, which seemed clean, did rather smell. Also, the large bath had a shower attachment, but it was not wall mounted and there was no curtain, so you couldn't really have a stand up shower. Otherwise it seemed clean and well kept. There is free use of a computer in the reception area (with a printer). Best of all was the location in the Marais, near the kosher restaurants, and extremely close to Notre Dame and 10 minutes walk to the main RER and Metro stops. It's a lively gay area, which may be a matter of interest or indifference to some travellers.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: yasmags
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after a disastrous experience with a Paris Stay apartment. A well run hotel with lovely staff in the best part of Paris. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quiet, Confortable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SatineLondon
Reviews.Content: We have a lovely 4 day stay at this hotel while visiting friends in Rue Des Archives. We didn't take the breakfast option, there are two wonderful bakeries within 100m. Our room was on the third floor (there's a lift) and faced into the small courtyard on the right of the entrance door. The room was quiet - even though we had the french door open a little - the room was very warm, although i'm not complaining about the warm room, it was very much appreciated in February! We just wanted a little fresh air. The room was small, but had everything you needed for a short stay. There was a four-poster bed which dominated the room, but was very very comfortable. No hesitation in recommending this hotel. Staff friendly and very helpful. Recommend Cafe Journaux on Rue Des Archives.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, small and friendly hotel in a lovely area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: sandieTS
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel where you feel welcome as soon as you step through the door. To say you are in the centre of Paris there is no street noise, beautifully quiet as is the hotel, which is bliss, especially at night, an oasis of calm. The breakfast room in the cellar is great with unlimited coffee, freshly squeezed orange juice, fruit salad and croissants, pastries, bread and the rest inc complimentary newspapers (inc The Guardian) and compared to all the cafes in the area is excellent value. Lovely, spotlessly clean bedrooms are characterful and french without being too chintzy. Comfortable bed with fresh white linen, nice marble bathrooms - the towels were changed even though I was only there for two nights and the staff are the friendliest Parisiens in Paris. The Marais district is wonderful, lots to see and do and easy to walk to the two Isles and over to St Germain de Pres. All in all absolutely wonderful, wish I could go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly, competent staff in a charming home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: MarieCarpentier
Reviews.Content: I have now been a guest at this lovely hotel for three visits to Paris. Staying at the Hotel Bretonnerie is such a sweet pleasure. Not a touristy place, but still one where the staff does whatever it takes to make your stay a pleasant one in Paris. One visit my friend became ill and the staff was amazing in their concern, contacting an English-speaking doctor, and demonstrating a true caring attitude about her health. It feels like I am with family. It is in the heart of the Marais with all the great shops and restaurants. Convenient to bus and metro, and perfect walking on your own. The rooms sparkle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: S_J_C_C
Reviews.Content: 4 poster bed. lovely staff. excellent location. clean. excellent value. trust the reviews when the evidence is overwhelming. moved here from the santoigne which was as dire as this was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: JM49
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and we weren't disappointed. This time we had a better (and more expensive) room. The room was comfortable and well-kept, if a bit cluttered with unnecessary furniture, and the bathroom was large, if slightly oddly designed (small bath, no shower, no heated towel rail). Our room overlooked a courtyard where noisy building work began each morning. Even so, we enjoyed our stay and would return. The staff are professional and friendly. But it's the location that really wins the day - 5 mins in one direction to the Pompidou Centre, 5 mins in the other to the Place de Vosges, and all the delights of the Marais on your doorstep. We skipped the hotel breakfast (disappointing last time) and had cafe-creme and tartine in one of the local cafes - a bit cheaper, and a lot more atmospheric (turn left out of the hotel and walk till you come a T-junction - the cafe is right in front of you.) We would come back here again. There's a good Moroccan restaurant just across the street from the hotel - L'Argentier (?) - we had the menu du jour there one day (not Moroccan at all - grilled chicken, frites and salad) and it was excellent and reasonable value. Also a nearby grocery a bit further along if you want to buy fruit, fresh milk and so on - we had a mini-bar fridge in the room to store them.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid during a heatave - no air con!”
Reviews.Author: InspectorSands
Reviews.Content: We checked this hotel out after checking in at the very clean, modern but not especially atmospheric or Parisian Hotel Duo nearby. Immediately this made a better impression, with a dark, rich red reception and a very friendly girl on reception who let us see the rooms before committing ourselves. Hmmm.... first up room had vile dark green decor that would make a leprechaun blanch. Others were better, though the hallway carpet was a bit worn and shabby. One main problem: no air con during a heatwave. Stifling hot, no fun at all. A big stand-up fan in one room tried to do the business. So we decided to stick with Hotel Duo and did not regret the decision. That said, this is great for location, no kidding, with lots of lovely shops nearby for browsing and the free interent is not to be sneezed at. Maybe another time, but I'd avoid the vile green room. "Verde, non! S'il vous plait!"

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location. Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA-NYC26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in April with my mother. She had been to Paris many times, and wanted to take me. She had stayed at Bretonnerie three times before, so it was a no brainner that we would stay there on our trip. This place really helped make my experience amazing. The location is so central and close to so much shopping!! The staff was friendly and helpful. We stayed in one of the lofts and it was great to have space away from the sleeping area. The neighborhood is lively and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, room was clean but depressing”
Reviews.Author: adventureawaits80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bretonnerie for three nights. I loved the neighborhood, with the variety of shops and historical sites. We were able to walk all over the place from here, partly because we were so enthusiastic about walking. The room itself had water stains on the walls. Linens and towels were very old. I got my toe caught in a hole in the sheet. Despite all this, the room still felt clean. It was just very old. The staircase carpet was extremely worn. There is no A/C, but the fan made the room fairly comfortable. I would have felt better about this if I hadn't been paying 135 Euros/night. I would recommend reserving a charming room over their classic room. It might be significantly better. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. They have a computer available for guests to use-- just make sure to choose the English keyboard setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to large, boring hotels”
Reviews.Author: BarkingElk
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is great, walking distance to many of the most popular tourist sites. And the neighborhood ... eclectic would be too mild of a word. Lots of shops and restaurants for all types of lifestyles. The sidewalk cafes were a seeming neverending party. As far as the hotel, no complaints at all. If you have ever looked for a triple room in Paris, you know it can be difficult. Ours was spacious, with good separation between the single and double beds, and a bathroom larger than some Paris bedrooms. It was located on the top floor underneath the roof gables, and portions of the room had low clearance leading to a few head bumps, but no permanent damage was done. Breakfast service was good, but not a necessity given all of the patisseries within a block or two. Desk clerks were friendly and helpful, and internet access was available from a public computer in the lobby. The elevator was tiny, posing the question of who should go up first, you or your luggage? (only a slight exaggeration) All in all, a great home base for a Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect small Parisian hotel; not too expensive; great location”
Reviews.Author: CMFriend
Reviews.Content: We had gotten a recommendation to stay here on our first trip to Paris in 2005, and quickly booked a second visit when we knew we were coming back in 2007. The staff are friendly, particulary if you speak French, and the place is absolutely charming. Fabulous location for walking throughout the Marais, and even across onto Isle de la Cite. I can't wait to have the occasion to book there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKGOL
Reviews.Content: Why stay anywhere else? Bretonnerie is the perfect Parisian hotel, full of charm, gracious staff and the perfect location - close to Place de Vosges but far enough West to be walking to everywhere else. Don't stay here if you want a Starwood experience - please, you'll spoil this hotel for the rest of us. If you want Audrey Hepburn Paris charm, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “WOW am staying here now”
Reviews.Author: nycmom22
Reviews.Content: Excellent location have taken but one cab many ,etros but ,ostly walked Fro, what I read on this site; rooms are large____let's share specifics as I'd like to learn of more rooms to use: We stayed in 1 and ,oved to 35 both 220 euros a night: for room & and for the base,ent brekfast; you cannot be over - feet tall: Warning no air conditioning which you need in summer Karen and Olga at front desk are great and reply to emails promptly

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: bathtubsailor
Reviews.Content: A very charming hotel, located in a fantastic neighborhood, surrounded by bistros, cafes, and sweet shops. The "classic" room was small, but the bathroom was sizeable. The room and the hotel are charmingly decorated. The staff were extremely helpful. The hotel was quiet and wireless was free in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It's like coming home!!!”
Reviews.Author: EpicurienCanada
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for 29 years and each stay is a wonderful experience!!! Only down side is ithat too many people now stay there and I must book months ahead of time. The staff is eh best I've ever seen and the romms are spectacular. Bravo La Bretonnerie!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: fisham
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at Hotel de la Bretonnerie. We had a junior suite as we were two adults and our son. The room was absolutely quiet at night, though we were in the heart of the very lively Marais. The hotel is charming and extremely well kept. The staff is unobtrusive yet extremely helpful when needed. Breakfast in the medieval looking 'cellar' was simple yet sufficient for our needs, with nice touches such as fresh orange juice and a small buffet. The hotel is in a great neighborhood and centrally located in the heart of Paris. If you are looking foe a clean well run small hotel at a good value, you will enjoy this hotel. If you are looking for concierge service and many extra amenities, this is probably not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: boaviagemnyc
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. It is a great location in the Marais, and close to metro, cultural sites, great bars and restaurants. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and courteous. We had some construction noise outside of our room which was unfortunate, but it was not the fault of the hotel's. The room was small, but for the price - could not have been beat. I recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “great service.”
Reviews.Author: amcvagabond
Reviews.Content: I'd like to start by writing how pleasant and accommodating the hotel Staff was. We arrived late to find our "charming" room (# 10) substandard and also had a very odd smell. We expressed our dissatisfaction and were immediately upgraded to a junior suite for the night at no extra charge (this was all they had available) The next morning without having to explain our situation to the day staff, we were given a choice of two other "charming" rooms. We chose #34 which was much nicer, a little bigger and all around more "charming" I think it's important with these reviews that a room number is mentioned as many hotels (especially in Europe) are not uniform and two rooms at the same rate are not always the same quality. We also had some friends visit us in Paris and they stayed in a "classic" room (#29) which was far nicer than our original room only a bit smaller. On a side note we stayed at the Bretonnerie in mid October 2008 and they were currently building a structure right next door. You may want to ask the hotel the status of the current construction before you make reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great service, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: I recently had two separate two-night stays at this charming hotel in the heart of the Marais. Both times, I stayed in room 19, a "classic room" (the Bretonnerie's term for a standard room). The room was spacious (for Paris), and very clean and comfortable. It was decorated in French country style, with wood-beamed ceilings and antique reproduction furniture. The only slight drawbacks of the room were the somewhat weak lighting and the lack of drawer space. The bathroom was sparkling clean and had a huge corner bathtub; water pressure and temperature were both great. The lobby was smallish but very well-decorated and welcoming. Two much appreciated features: the computer with free Internet access (though the French keyboard was a bit challenging) and the many free books, many of them in English, left by previous guests. The staff working at the front desk were all gracious and helpful, especially Karen. A bountiful and excellent continental breakfast is served in a tranquil, cheerful cellar breakfast room with vaulted ceilings. Fresh squeezed orange juice, excellent cafe au lait and first-rate breakfast breads and pastries made for a great start to the day. Cold meats and cheeses were also served, but I didn't try those. The location of the hotel was just perfect, with so many sights within easy walking distance. Although the neighborhood was lively, and my room faced the front of the hotel, I had no problems with street noise once my window was closed. I would happily stay here again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “yikes”
Reviews.Author: nicola6dublin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Bretonnerie as scheduled at midnight to being a five night stay. They had no reservation for us and no cot as pre arranged for our baby. With no apology, they found us a room (without a cot) and told us we would have to change to another in the morning. The room was nice and we were still hopeful of a nice stay at that point. How wrong we were. The next morning we went down to see our new room to find the floor covered in plastic, with workmens' ladders dotted around the place and loose cables coming out of the walls. The maid hushed us out and said to come back in the afternoon when the room would "be in service". We returned and all seemed well until we switched on a bed side light and the fan on the other side of the room stopped working. We plugged the fan into another socket and it caused yet another lamp to blow out (with sparks). I won't bore you with the details but this continued on and on for the next four days unitl we left. With little natural light, we dressed ourselves and the baby in the dark and the phone line never worked at all. We complained daily to be told the manager was not there but would be back the next day. He never showed up during our stay there. The final straw came on the last night when returning from a long day out (we never wanted to spend very long in the hotel), we got into the lift, only for the power to fail completely. Our baby was terrified and with no working alarm bell, we had to ring back home to Ireland to get them to ring the hotel to tell them we were stuck in the lift. It sounds comical but it wasn't! In the end, they gave us €175 euro off the total bill of €800 but we would much rather have paid the full price at a different hotel and not had this awful hassle. As we were checking out, the receptionist finally came close to apologising by admitting our room was not ready to let out in the first place. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location; Friendly Helpful Staff and Comfortable, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jadoreparee
Reviews.Content: We were 3 females - varying in age from 30's to 60's - and had a wonderful triple room on the 3rd floor, looking into a small bare courtyard. The room was decorated with Parisian flair and was a generous "U' shape - space is a premium in Paris - and the loo was compact but spotless. The separate bathroom perfectly adequate. The third bed was a rollaway and the youngest said "totally comfortable"! All the staff were very helpful and friendly - the free internet in the lobby was a bonus - and the fact that you are just around the corner from the Hotel de Ville - and BHV (one of "THE" department stores) as well as numerous little cafes and bars is an added bonus. Wouldn't hesitate to return for another stay and consider it absolute value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in great location for young people”
Reviews.Author: BrunswickBabe
Reviews.Content: Location! Location! Location! This is a great hotel in the very lively 4th district. Rooms are on the small side, the staff was friendly (but no overly helpful), but the place felt safe (I was traveling alone-woman in her 30's). You can walk to almost every site from this hotel, and there are many great restaurants and cafes in this neighborhood. At night, the 4th is VERY busy and the streets are filled with people. I liked this, but it was also loud at night and way into the early hours of the morning. I would not recommend this hotel to families or to older couples.

Reviews.Title: “The most charming hotel we have visited”
Reviews.Author: MaxStirner
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this lovely hotel during last December (four nights) and found it to be a very charming, clean, friendly and perfectly (perfectly!) located place to stay. The hotel is located in the 4th District, the Marais, close to the ancient Jewish quarter. The Metro is close (Hotel de Ville) and one can use to get around Paris. The room was a good size, with a very beautiful bathroom. The breakfast at the hotel was fantastic. The staff extremely helpful and descreet, free Internet access in lobby and room. We found the hotel to be extremely quiet and felt very safe in this area. Lots of superb restaurants and shops around (try the restaurant "Le Coude Fou", 12 rue du Bourg-Tibourg). We would recommend this hotel for a great, romantic stay in Paris and we are sure we will come back, one day. Fabio and Roberta

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Quique02
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in the centre of the Marais District. Our "charming" double room was facing the courtyard on the second floor (third floor for us Yankees). Mattress was comfortable as well as the pillows. Lighting in the room was not very good at night. Taking off the lampshade of one of the lamps really helped. The bathroom was clean and pretty spacious; the only negative is that it had the European shower set up, which means you sit in the tub and hold the shower head to bathe. The building was very charming, near many restaurants, bars and trendy shops. There was free internet in the lobby and the staff was very friendly. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, too expensive, but there were many places near by to do so. Good hotel, good price.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller47
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Bretonnerie Sept 11-13. Can't say enough about this great little hotel. Had room on 3rd floor..by Paris standards the room was enormous! ( Friends came by to pick us up for dinner and 6 of us could actually sit in the room comfortably) French doors overloking narrow street, exposed beams, extra pillows. Very comfortable double bed plus a single so would be a good choice for a family travelling with one child. Bathroom was very modern with twin basins, and a shower you could actually stand up in, (there was the usual hand shower but it could be placed on the bar to be a standing shower!) Breakfast was extra but well worth it.. not the usual croissant.. rather they had a machine that made fresh oj on demand, several cereals, assorted buns, fresh fruit , unlimited coffee. PLUS there was excellent free internet access in the small lobby. Helpful desk staff. Very near to transit at Hotel de Ville or Chatelet, lots of cafes for a little bite and people watching....and really good shopping all around. Usually stay in the Latin Quarter but will definitely stay again at this hotel when we are next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little place”
Reviews.Author: lindaLLondon_Ontario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel Sept 11 - 13, 2007 and found it to be a very clean, friendly and perfectly located place to stay. Located in the 4th District, the Metro is close by (Hotel de Ville) which we used exclusively to get around Paris. Arrived by taxi from the airport (40 Euros + tip) and were allowed to store our suitcases (morning arrival) until our room was ready. The room was a good size, no air conditioner but room fan (which helped greatly) with separate bathroom and shower/tub. Did not have breakfast at the hotel (lots of bake shops and even a Starbucks around the corner). Staff extremely helpful, free Internet access in lobby and we found the hotel to be extremely quiet and felt very safe in this area. Lots of restaurants within a block or two. Can take the Metro to the train station or taxi (about 7 Euros). Would recommend this hotel for a great stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Pukekho
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris about 20 times and have stayed at this little hotel the last 6 times. I found it while wandering through the Marais and thought it was just the right mix of location and charm. What makes it different from other hotels are the large bedrooms (apart from the odd exception) and the staff. They are mostly not french so have great english and sans attitude (even when I witnessed their tempers being tested by a senile old American) There are literally dozens of great restaurants within a five minute walk and they are not all tourist traps (this a gay/Jewish quarter after all). This is the only part of Paris open on Sundays apart from the markets so it is a hub of activity. The only negative is those damn french shower heads on metal tubes in the bath that you have to hold on to!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice stay, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pacifica_traveler
Reviews.Content: My 18-year old daughter and I spent a week in Paris and we stayed at this quite charming, and fairly large, property located in the Marais district, walkablely close to many attractions. This property was quite fine for our needs. We didn't opt for the breakfast, so I can't comment on that, but our room was a good size (a Chambre de Charme), located on the 3rd floor facing the street. We had a fan (which is essential!!) and managed to stay comfortable, not too hot or too cold, even with the ever-fluctuating Paris weather. The elevators are a bit small by American standards, but were actually more prompt at appearing than many American hotels. The showers may appear a bit strange since the showerhead is hand-held and the shower itself isn't completely enclosed, so not getting the floor wet might be a challenge! Also, there was a separate urinal, which I guess is mostly a European thing..... What I want to mention mostly is that we had quite a bit of help from the woman at the front desk as we were making our leave. We had attempted to call a taxi to take us to the AirFrance bus pickup spot....but be warned.....IT IS NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE TO GET A TAXI IN PARIS!!!! for reasons I won't get into here. However, we managed to finally get a taxi directly to the airport, which was arranged by our desk clerk. While I'm not sure if there isn't a special number you can call to get a taxi (some others did themselves), it was greatly appreciated that the staff went the extra mile to insure that we got the the airport.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc2theworld
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to read anything but glowing reviews of this hotel - of the places my mom and I stayed in during this year's European trip, Bretonnerie was, hands down, our favorite. Very helpful staff, cozy suite (bi-level, and with the best, newest, cleanest & coziest bathroom & bathtub I have ever seen in a european hotel), the yummy in-room breakfast, the fab location - I will probably stay here again whenever I'm able. Thanks for the lovely 4 nights! Mom loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely come beck to this small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nelli_Pforzheim
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Paris and I was happy to find a small charming hotel in the Marais. I was in the charming room (n 20). The room is clean maybe a bit old but it makes it charming, the room was big, that surprise me as I herd that Parissian hotels The people on the desk are friendly and very helpful; they advised me very nice places for diners and some places to visit. I will definitely come beck to this small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, facilities and service!!”
Reviews.Author: kyla20475
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during my visit to Paris in Feb 2007. Great rooms - clean, tastefully decorated. Fantastic value for the location - it was so easy for us to hit all the tourist spots!! More importantly - the staff here are incredibly warm, helpful AND speak perfect English (this is almost unheard of in France and even in Paris). We had such a great time - we are definitely coming back the next time we are in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Two-Star in the heart of Marais”
Reviews.Author: LookingForAstronauts
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a nice area of Paris, close to shops, restaurants and walkable to most of the sights. We were looking for somewhere budget friendly, so this is pretty much what we were expecting. People in Paris smoke everywhere, so the room smelled of smoke which bothered me at first. Our room (#4) was pretty large and also had a very large bathroom. I found the room to be a bit dreary and old but my boyfriend found it be a charming. The shower does not have curtains but I think that is pretty normal for Paris. People at reception were nice and helpful. If you are on a budget, stay here for the great location, but I would consider this more of a 2 star than a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “I guess I'm not going there!”
Reviews.Author: AmySRQ
Reviews.Content: On the advice of a friend, we were very excited to book rooms at the Hotel de la Bretonnerie. When I initially wrote to them in December, I was told to write back in June to make reservations for September. However, a good friend who stays there a few times a year on business offered to secure two rooms during his stay In February. After he returned from Paris, we received a written confirmation by email from the hotel. At that time, they asked us to check in with them to reconfirm six months in advance, April. So, at the beginning of April, we started to e-mail the hotel to reconfirm and add another room for friends who want to join us. No reply. No reply. Finally, we tried another e-mail address from which we had received correspondence at some point during the process. They did reply and informed us, without any apology, that they were already full and would not honor our reservations. Needless to say, at six months out, our choices for hotels are becoming limited. Staying in the Marais for a comparable price is simply no longer possible. Finding three rooms only complicates the matter. We are obviously very upset by this and would strongly suggest you proceed cautiously with this establishment, or not at all.

Reviews.Title: “We loved to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruth007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-day stay at this lovely hotel and we enjoyed it very much. The staff is very helpful and friendly, the entrance hall is decorated with georgeous bouquets of flowers and the rooms and bathrooms are spacious and nicely decorated. We can highly recommend this hotel which - on top of it - is located near the most famous Paris attractions like Notre Dame, Louvre, Left Bank, etc..

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a fantastic location (Marais)”
Reviews.Author: dalmazd
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the hotel de la Bretonnerie. It was a lovely cosy hotel. we stayed in a charming room (number 25), the room was big enough and the bathroom was also lovely and spacious! our room was in the back so it was very quiet! we didn't had breakfast at the hotel, because there are a lot bakeries in the neighbourhood whith great food. the location (Marais quartier) is fantastic! a lot of cafes, restaurants and great shops! we walked everywhere, but you can also take the subway! I would recommend this hotel and especially Le Marais Quartier!!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! Fantastic location. We stayed a week here in one of their very reasonably priced junior suites, which I strongly recommend you go with, they’re worth the extra cost. The suite consisted of two rooms, one bedroom and one "living space", which were quite big by Parisian standards. Breakfast provided in the hotel was a basic French affair, but more than adequate. The bathroom was clean and spacious, and our room even had a little balcony. Staff were pleasant and cordial, which compared to some hotels in Paris was a surprise and a welcome change. The location is fantastic… right in the middle of the enigmatic Marais. This is the Parisian “gay quarter”, but whether you’re gay (which I am) or straight, this little quarter of Paris is a delight to be in any time of the day or night:- great restaurants, excellent cafés and bars all around the hotel, and a real buzz about the place. Easy access to the metro, and only a short walk to Notre Dame and the George Pompidou, and great shopping on the Rue de Rivoli nearby. We loved every minute of our stay here and would make a point of going back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: jimbob_uk
Reviews.Content: Saw this hotel scored highly on TripAdvisor so gave it a go. The location was excellent - easy walking distance to the river and Notre Dame, which is also a stop for most of the tourist busses. Staff very friendly and rooms individual and comfortable, although not particularly large. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is our room smelled a bit of stale smoke, though I guess we may have been moved if we'd complained about it.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hotel Bretonnerie and had a lovely time. While the room was smallish by American standards, it was very spacious and comfortable by European standards. The bathroom in particular was lovely - one reviewer noted that there is no shower curtain, but that is, again, typical of European hotels and homes. We were there in the middle of gay pride and while the streets were bustling, the rooms were as quiet as could be. Of particular note is the receptionist Karen, who was very friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, a great location.”
Reviews.Author: InMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bretonnerie for 9 nights in mid May, 06. This hotel has a lot going for it. The location in the Marais is great, one of the quaintest areas in Paris. There are lots of restaurants, interesting stores and bakeries. It is also very centrally located and walking distance to most of Paris. The street can be a bit noisy at night but the double paned glass keeps out most of the merriment. This hotel does not have air-conditioning and leaving windows open may let in too much noise. You may want a room in the back if you want quiet. This is the epicenter of the gay area of Paris. If that bothers you then another location might be better The staff here is exceptionally helpful and friendly. Everyone from the maids to the front desk clerks could not have nicer. There is free internet in the lobby. They had just installed Wi-Fi but we could not get it to work in our room. The price of 114E for a double room was a great value. It is very easy to spend much more and not get a much better hotel. The entry and public rooms are very nicely done. A huge vase of fresh flowers welcomes you into the lobby. The rooms are finished in interesting fabrics although they are no longer as fresh as pictured on their web site. The carpet in our room was a bit worn and ready for replacement. We were unable to get a room with twin beds for the entire stay so we changed to a room with a double bed half way through our stay. Both rooms were nicely done and of good size. The bathrooms were spacious with a bidet and tub but only had a hand held shower. Some other guests remarked to us that their double room in the back was much smaller. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so I can not comment on that. All and all I would definitely stay at this hotel again. We had a chance to check out some other hotels in this price range and some less expensive. The Bretonnerie was definitely a stand out in this category.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: ASB1979
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel. On the positive side - it's in a great location (the Marais is lovely), the staff are competent (if not especially friendly), the room was clean, quite cosy and fairly quiet and you could indeed get a nice breakfast delivered to your room (on time) as the website claims. However, there were a few things that would stop me giving this hotel a totally positive review. Firstly, the room and bed were pretty small (we stayed in room 9 which looks really nice and spacious on the site); secondly, they have tried to save money in odd areas such as the 1970s hairdryer which gets really hot if you have it on for more than a minute and the lack of shower curtain which means you have to sit in the small bath to shower!; thirdly, the breakfast room is a bit depressing and was experiencing heavy leaks through the ceiling during our stay and finally, on the last day we returned to our room at around 11pm to find our door had been left open - the chambermaid had left it on the latch by mistake and it had been open for almost 12 hours! fortunately, no-one had noticed/taken advantage and nothing had been taken. However, the attitude of the staff was a bit defensive on being informed of this and although they did apologise, no compensation was offered. Overall, it's a reasonable place but arguably attention to detail is lacking...

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay...after all”
Reviews.Author: abw
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the Gare du Nord. Taxi had no problem finding the hotel once he could understand what I was saying. We had booked a chambre de charme for 3 persons, and when we arrived in our room, there was one double bed. We immediately went downstairs to straighten out the situation and were told that a cot would be brought in. I expressed my disappointment, saying I had expected a room for 3, not a room for 2 with a cot jammed in and was told rather brusquely that this was a room for 3. (With the cot, there was almost no room to move about the room.) We left immediately for dinner because it was already quite late, and when we returned, one of the receptionists informed us that if we left our bags packed in the morning, they would move us to a bigger room for the same rate. Well, the new room couldn't have been lovelier. There was a double bed and a twin, new bathroom, quiet floor. We had a wonderful stay, after all, but we never did see the nasty receptionist again. All the other staff was very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: skyfive1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed her and rented 2 rooms at the front of the hotel.The situation is very conveniant and the rooms were clean and comfortable.It is in the centre of a gay area.We didn't like the confusion over our booking.The receptionist asked us to leave mid stay as she had made an error with our booking.I had to prove that we had reserved the room for 4 nights as she had "lost" my email.Eventually she agreed that she had made an error!!! .I would not want to stay here again.It left me with a bitter taste.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but no A/C is a problem”
Reviews.Author: Hallvard7
Reviews.Content: Tiny room (#29, 3rd floor, facing the street), but beautiful. Not luxury, but personality. Nice bathroom. When Paris gets hot, the lack of aircondition is enough of a reason not to stay there, although there is a portable electric fan (or you can ask for one). Open windows could prove too noisy for some during the night, although the street is a generally quiet one. Breakfast in a cosy cellar - fresh orange juice, great pastries, but rather expensive at 9,5 euros. Good baguette sandwiches to be picked up at nearby bakeries. Other comments here mention the presence of gays in this area, and they are right that it is hard not to notice. However, only intolerant people would be offended. The location in Le Marais is wonderful, one of several good reasons to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just recently came back from Paris staying at Hotel de la Bretonnerie. If you are after a small character hotel in a central location then this hotel is right for you. We were travelling as a family of four, my husband, myself and two young daughters and we were very happy with our family room which by the looks of it had been renovated recently. It was decorated in red and white material, and although a little ornate, we found it very much typical of French decor. It was very clean, the bathroom was marble with huge bath (lovely to stretch out in) and hand held shower attachement which is very adequate and typcial of European style. There is a separate toilet which was useful for the four of us. Our girls were in the same room but at the opposite end (the room is in the shape of a capital I) which made it more separate - each had their own bed. The hotel itself is located in an ideal area- not far at all from Notre Dame and had lots of trendy shops and bars around. The nearest metro is minutes away, in fact I think there are two nearby to the hotel. People have commented that it is a gay area and this is true but we had no problem with that (made it more intersting). Be prepared for queues at the Eiffel Tower, and check that you can go right to the top of Notre Dame before paying to go up as the very top was closed until the afternoon on the day we went. Walking along the Seine River is a delight and Paris itself is very beautiful, the architecture and atmosphere is wonderful. Somehow the French manage to still retain their autonomy despite a changing Europe which is rare in the European countries. And it will be this that will hopefully delight the traveller. Having two young daughters we also (bravely and with some dread) ventured into spending a day at Paris Disneyland. Fortunately the day was very bearable -going out of season helped - we were there the 2nd week of June. We took the RER Ile-de-France train from Chatelet right through to Marne-la-Vallee-Chessy all clearly marked to Parcs Disneyland. The train actually takes you right into Disneyland, about 40 mins. We arrived at around 10:00 am with no tickets and waited for less than 10 mins to buy the Park entry ticket (Adult was 41 Euros each and 33 Euros for Children). We only queued for two rides (from 20 - 30 mins) and managed to see everything we set out to see making it easy and getting our value for money. Unless you are really into "theme parks" I wouldn't suggest staying in the Themed hotels on site - we were definitely ready to go by 6:30 pm. My only negative point on our 3 days in Paris was we were (surprisingly) disappointed with our meals out. We have been to France before and remember the great cooking and meals but this time sadly no. I don't know if this was whether we unlucky or if we just picked the wrong places. We did ask the hotel where the best place to eat was and they told us of one place called Camille (I think) but although the food was adequate it wasn't anything special and to make matters worse it was filled with lots of English tourists and they even handed us an English worded menu - not the French experience that we were after! Even the breakfast, which the hotel recommended was, although very good, run by Belgiums. We did manage to see a great vegetarian place (in the same road as the hotel) showing their pastries, quiches and flans in the window and we went in and had two helpings of the tarts which were wonderful (and there they did speak only French). My daughter loved her Croque Madame! Apart from the bad choice of restaurants we loved our time in Paris - it's a magical city and I can recommend Hotel de la Bretonnerie as a charming hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Marais, but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_TravelsSF
Reviews.Content: Good points = this hotel is located in the heart of the Marais, a beautiful neighborhood with great shops (Petit Bateau, Mariage Freres -- a wonderful tea shop, myriad others) and cafes/restaurants. Exactly what you hope Paris will be. You can spend the whole day productively without going farther than a few blocks. Service was friendly, and housekeeping was excellent. There is a computer in the lobby so that you can check the internet. The bathroom had been recently renovated and was generally very nice -- double vanity, large soaking tub. Unfortunately, despite this renovation, the shower was a hand held one. Sitting down and holding this shower handle over your head may not go over well with many visitors. Couple things on the negative side: interior of hotel looks a bit down-at-the-heels, carpets are worn to threadbare, and, most problematically, the bed was truly uncomfortable. We had a junior suite (180 Euro), supposedly one of their top rooms, but this bed made sleeping quite tough. Additionally, smoke from the smokers staying next door got into our room in the mornings, which was unpleasant. Finally, the windows are very thick, double-paned, and shut out all noise. However, unless they were closed, too much street noise from nearby cafes/bars got in, but if they were closed, the room became far too stuffy to sleep. Also, there was no assistance with our luggage, so we were on our own to cram suitcases inside the world's tiniest elevator, and drag them to our room. To address one thing raised in another review on this site -- someone implied this was an extremely ("uncomfortably") gay area of Paris. That is crazy -- there are a couple gay establishments in the area, but this area is far more like Pacific Heights rather than the Castro in San Francisco, or the Upper West Side in NYC rather than the Village. Not that there's anything wrong with the Castro/Village, but it's just not the vibe of this area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent 3-star (for Paris)”
Reviews.Author: ChrisVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in the late April, 2005. It is in the heart of the Marais district which is a great place to base your exploration of this great city. Le Marais is charming, bustling, gay, Jewish (part of it) and central. You can walk anywhere in Paris from here or take the metro if it is raining. This hotel is on one of many narrow, quaint cobblestone streets with lots of nearby bars, restaurants, cafes, etc. The people who run the hotel are friendly and helpful (by Parisian standards). Make sure you book way in advance (months) or you will be disappointed. After looking around this and other central areas we realized this place is a bargain and great value (for Paris). We were in their least expensive room type at 110 Euros per night - no multiple day discounts. This city is expensive - if you think the accommodation is expensive, wait until you start paying to eat out! It is easy to walk (2 short blocks) with your wheeled luggage from the metro stop at hotel de ville. There is a tiny elevator (2 people or 2 bags, not both) and 5 floors. The decor is traditional with exposed timbers in places. Everything is clean and basic, this is not a luxury hotel. Our room was small and the bed even smaller. A standard bed for Paris but very difficult for 2 people - about the size of a standard double bed in North America but seemed shorter. This is the standard in Paris though unless you want to pay $500 US equivalent a night. Don't know why - the people seem to be the same height (though much thinner) and the bed is small even if you find a large room. The bathrooms were large, somewhat modern, clean and complete with bidet. They unfortunately have the large tub with no shower or curtain so you have to sit and spray yourself if you don't want to flood the entire place (again - why? - a shower would easily fit). The bed was uncomfortable by North American standards but adequate (except that size thing). There was barely enough room for your luggage on the floor and we kept tripping on it. There are no amenities in the hotel except for free internet in the lobby - kudos to this this hotel as this is very unsusual and if a hotel has it here they often charge a lot (20 Euros per hour) to use it. Customer service is not a big thing in Paris - hotels or restaurants - but that is part of the charm :) Hint about food - avoid the cafes for meals and go to a restaurant for much better value and quality. Better than that , frequently picnic - the food (and wine!) in the groceries (one around the corner from this hotel) is cheap by comparison and excellent quality. Our best meals were sitting on a bench in a park or on the wall of the Seine. Word of warning - this, and seemingly most hotels in Paris are fire traps. Alternate exits or fire escapes are unheard of. Smoke detectors are rare, no one seemed to know what a sprinkler was! The outside of most buildings were not made for climbing. We almost bought a rope and would consider it next time. A travel smoke detector would not be a bad idea either. This is not to single out this hotel as this is standard but the one very narrow stairway from the top floor was very sobering. All the above aside, this place is a find (for Paris) and we would definitely go back. Learn some French (just "bonjour" helps immensely) and roll with the "rudeness" and you will have a great time in this city. The staff at the hotel are there 24 hours a day and always willing to help. Take a day or two to skip the museums, etc and just wander the streets in Le Marais - one of the best things we found to do in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: smh222
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris and stayed in this hotel March 20-22. What a charming little gem! The decor is beautiful - our room had lots of toile fabrics in deep red and mustard (room 36). The bathrooms seemed to have been remodeled recently and I loved how the toilet was in one room, and the sink and tub were in another - great setup. FYI - the tub has just a handheld shower device (no shower curtain)- just a little different if you are not used to that. The huge french windows with beautiful wrought iron railings opened onto the busy street below, but surprisingly the street noise did not keep us up - it seemed to die down and with the windows closed, you could not hear much. This was a Sunday and Monday night though. We loved just keeping the window open and enjoying the buzz of activity from the street below before going to sleep. We paid 110E for this room and I think it was a great value. The previous week we paid just a little less than that for a less charming 2-star in the Latin Quarter. Even the lobby area and other common areas were very charming - exposed beams, lace curtains, etc. Oh, and the complimentary internet in the lobby was great! Just don't hog it like on particular guest did while we were there ( : The location is great too. Close to Notre Dame, a plethora of cafes and shops, and also Metro/RER stops. Oh, we did noticed the area is a tad bit gay. Not overwhelmingly so, but if you have any aversion to that (shame on you) you might not like this area particularly. I am surprised there are not more reviews for this hotel on this website. I would most definitely stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de la Bretonnerie
HotelInfo.Address: 22 rue Sainte-Croix de la Bretonnerie | 04 Arr., 75004 Paris, France
